title: How to Host a Bead Bracelet Party

steps.headline: Decide where you are going to host a bead bracelet party.
steps.description: The best place is probably your home. If this is not an option, you might consider a community center or a church that would let you hold a party free of charge.

steps.headline: Pick a date and a time to host your bracelet party.
steps.description: You will need to think about other events in your area that might conflict with the date you choose. Think about what would be the best time for your friends to attend your bracelet party.

steps.headline: Write down a list of the friends you plan to invite.
steps.description: You'll want to decide on a number of guests before beginning this list. Inviting 4 to 8 friends would make a great party.

steps.headline: Purchase, complete, and mail the invitations.
steps.description: You'll want to mail these at least 7 days in advance to give your friends plenty of time to mark the date on their calendars. Be sure to include the location and don't forget to emphasize this is a fun party, where they will get to make a bead bracelet of their very own.

steps.headline: Buy beads, cording, individual plastic bowls for displaying beads, latches for bracelets, and any drinks or refreshments you plan to serve.
steps.description: If you are ordering any of these items on line, be sure to allow time for the items to be shipped to your home.

steps.headline: Make a sample bead bracelet ahead of time.
steps.description: Be ready to demonstrate to your guests how to make a bead bracelet or print directions before the party for your guests to follow.

steps.headline: Create a list of things to do the day of the bracelet party.
steps.description: You may wish to clean the room where you'll be hosting the party, prepare special foods, set up the work space by organizing beads in individual bowls, and get yourself dressed and ready well in advance of the arrival of your first guest.

steps.headline: Help your guests to feel welcome and relaxed when the party begins.
steps.description: Plan to assist anyone who needs help making their bead bracelet. Your bead bracelet party will be a success if you are organized, and if you are having fun.

steps.headline: Send at least one bead bracelet home with each guest.
steps.description: If anyone had trouble making a bracelet, give them your sample bracelet. If several bead bracelets are made, you might want to donate some to a charity event in your area.
